title: Shoppers say Fashion Nova's revealing Toy Story costumes are 'ruining childhoods'
text:

Re-watching Toy Story reminds us of a simpler time in our lives and we'll always hold a special place in our hearts for Buzz and Woody.

With Halloween trends turning from spooky to sexy more and more each year, it seems that not even our childhood heroes are immune from a revealing makeover.

Online retailer Fashion Nova has released a line of Toy Story-inspired Halloween outfits , showing our favourite cowboy and space ranger in a very different light.

With a price tag of around £48, even the Pizza Planet aliens are subject to a suggestive re-design.

(Image: Fashion Nova)

The American brand is careful not to directly link the range to the popular animation series, naming the cowboy outfit 'New Sheriff in Town' - which looks a lot like Woody forgot to wear his trousers.

'Infinite & Beyond' and 'Ooooh The Claw' also both resemble Buzz Lightyear and the aliens washing their outfits on the wrong heat setting.

The costumes have proved a big hit as they continue to sell out fast, with fans flooding Fashion Nova's Instagram page with comments asking if the outfits will be back in stock before October 31.

(Image: Fashion Nova)

(Image: Fashion Nova)

Not everyone felt the same way, with one simply commenting 'childhood ruined'.

Another asked "I wonder if people really buy these and go trick or treating?" while a third commented 'save it for the strip club'.

They aren't the only characters which seem to have inspired Fashion Nova costumes with Space Jam, Beetlejuice, Jessica Rabbit and Cruella de Vil all looking very recognisable on the website.

It's also not the first time Fashion Nova has raised a few eyebrows among film fans after a 'buckle up mock neck romper' was quickly compared to something from the 'slutty Matrix' .

We'll never watch Toy Story in the same way again.
description: Fashion Nova's Halloween outfits are selling out fast - but not everyone is convinced
